channel.title: What linux based OS should I get
channel.description:
Well I haven't been on much because my hard drive is well done. (Ran a diagnostic test critical/fatal error in disk drive c:/ )
So I have decided to get a new computer and not get another hard-drive since my laptop isn't good enough for all I want to do. Only a 100gb hard-drive, 1gb Ram , 2.1mhz so it wasn't all that. I have decided to get a desktop (used). It has 4gb or ram 150gb of hard-drive space and its processing speed is 2.9mhz.
I wanted to switch to a linux based OS for a while and I though this would be the perfect time to do so. So, please tell me what Linux based OS I should get. So far I thinking of getting Ubuntu.
Im on the computer at school soposed to be finishing a website but eh don't feel like it.

item.title: What linux based OS should I get
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:368214”][quote author=Pluvia link=topic=464365.msg3396328#msg3396328 date=1289426916]

I use Kubuntu, it is the same as Ubuntu, it just comes with a different display manager by default. You just need to decide whether you like KDE or Gnome better (I’d use Xfce instead of gnome), but you can install one, and simply install and use the other display manager any time you want.

Could you explain a little more about the differences between Gnome, Xfce, KDE?
[/quote]

GNOME, KDE = heavyweight, eat up memory/cpu, similar style to m$ windows
Xfce = lightweight, minimal, cough better cough

I run arch linux with xfce so I would recommend Xubuntu for you (it’s a ubuntu derivative)[/quote]

Alrighty thanks

Read full topic
item.source: What linux based OS should I get

item.title: What linux based OS should I get
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Pluvia, post:5, topic:368214”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=464365.msg3396113#msg3396113 date=1289412103]
I use Kubuntu, it is the same as Ubuntu, it just comes with a different display manager by default. You just need to decide whether you like KDE or Gnome better (I’d use Xfce instead of gnome), but you can install one, and simply install and use the other display manager any time you want.
[/quote]
Could you explain a little more about the differences between Gnome, Xfce, KDE?[/quote]

GNOME, KDE = heavyweight, eat up memory/cpu, similar style to m$ windows
Xfce = lightweight, minimal, cough better cough

I run arch linux with xfce so I would recommend Xubuntu for you (it’s a ubuntu derivative)

Read full topic

item.title: What linux based OS should I get
item.dc:creator: @Pluvia Pluvia
item.description:
@Pluvia wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I use Kubuntu, it is the same as Ubuntu, it just comes with a different display manager by default. You just need to decide whether you like KDE or Gnome better (I’d use Xfce instead of gnome), but you can install one, and simply install and use the other display manager any time you want.

Could you explain a little more about the differences between Gnome, Xfce, KDE?

item.title: What linux based OS should I get
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Generally I use Ubuntu and LUbuntu. Ubuntu is generally, one of the most popular linux bases OS’s around. I just like Lubuntu though because I have a low-end laptop that it runs smooth on. I would suggest Ubuntu though, as it is more known, and with those specs, would run just fine.

Read full topic
